page.title: 20UPWEY,A SUMMARY CONCLUSION
page.content:
UPWEY IS A SMALL OUTLYING VILLAGE ACTING AS A RURAL SUBURB FOR THE HOLIDAY TOWN OF WEYMOUTH. ALTHOUGH NOT VERY LARGE THE VILLAGE AREA OFFERS ENOUGH FACILITIES FOR THE LOCAL POPULATION.
ALL THE INFORMATION IN THIS PART OF THE DOMESDAY SURVEY WAS COLLECTED AND COMPILED BY THE{CLASS MEMBERS OF "1O"} AT{BROADWEY SECONDARY SCHOOL}IN WEYMOUTH. THE TASK OF PUTTING IT ONTO THIS COMPUTER DISC WAS UNDERTAKEN BY TWO PUPILS ONLY:{DENISE APSEY}AND{ANDREW} {HYETT,}WITH AN OCCAISIONAL HELPING HAND FROM{MR.K.FORTY.} AS A FOOTNOTE BROADWEY SCHOOL ITSELF WILL FROM NOW ON BE KNOWN AS THE WEY VALLEY SCHOOL.
